articles.title: Kim Yong Il Greets UK PM
articles.content:
Kim Yong Il Greets UK PM
 Pyongyang, May 14 (KCNA) -- DPRK Premier Kim Yong Il Thursday sent a congratulatory message to David Cameron upon his appointment as Prime Minister of the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland.
					 Hoping that the relations between the two countries would develop on good terms, the message wished the Prime Minister successes in his work.
					
					 Meanwhile, DPRK Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun sent a congratulatory message to William Hague upon his appointment as UK foreign secretary.

articles.title: Kim Yong Il Greets Thai PM
articles.content:
Kim Yong Il Greets Thai PM
Pyongyang, May 14 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Il, premier of the DPRK, sent a message of greetings to Abhisit Vejjajiva, Prime Minister of Thailand, on May 8 on the occasion of the 35th anniversary of the establishment of diplomatic ties between the two countries.
					 The message said that the two countries have steadily boosted the friendly and cooperative relations on the principle of respect for sovereignty, equality and mutual benefits over the past 35 years.
					
					Hoping that the bilateral of friendship and cooperation would more energetically develop in different fields in the common interests of the two governments and peoples in the future, too, the message wished the Prime Minister success in his work for stability and prosperity of the country.
					
					 DPRK Foreign Minister Pak Ui Chun sent a similar message to his Thai counterpart Kasit Piromya that day.

articles.title: Decision on Relieving Kim Il Chol of All Posts Issued
articles.content:
Decision on Relieving Kim Il Chol of All Posts Issued
 Pyongyang, May 14 (KCNA) -- Kim Il Chol was relieved of the posts as member of the National Defence Commission of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea and first vice-minister of the People's Armed Forces for his advanced age of 80, according to Decision No. 06 of the NDC issued on May 13.

articles.title: New Mushroom Cultivation Methods Developed
articles.content:
New Mushroom Cultivation Methods Developed
 Pyongyang, May 14 (KCNA) -- The Mushroom Institute under the State Academy of Sciences of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea has succeeded in the research into quick cultivation methods of Lentinus edodes.
					 The mushroom had usually been cultivated with spores cultured on chopped pieces of oak, maple or other trees.
					
					 One of the two newly-developed methods is that spawns are cultured in a bottle or vinyl bag before being cultured again into a big lump of fungi and another one is that a pouched substrate is inoculated with spores and cultured before the mushroom cultivation outside the pouch.
					
					 The methods, in which by-products of wood processing factories and agricultural fields are mainly used, are available in any places. In particular mountainous areas can make a great profit on them at low cost.
					
					 Ri Son Hui, 45, head of the institute, told KCNA that it has fully solved various technological issues such as selection of species for quick cultivation to suit the actual conditions of the country and enhancement of germination rate of fungi.
					
					 The new methods make it possible to harvest the mushroom within ten months, while reducing the production cycle by more than a half compared to the previous methods. Two or three months are enough for spawn cultivation. 
					
					 They, less affected by seasonal and environmental changes, can increase production, reducing the consumption of timber.

articles.title: Light Comedy "Echo of Mountain" Performed in Haeju
articles.content:
Light Comedy "Echo of Mountain" Performed in Haeju
 Pyongyang, May 14 (KCNA) -- The light comedy "Echo of Mountain", winner of Kim Il Sung Prize, has been staged before full house in Haeju, South Hwanghae Province since May 13.
					 The first day performance of the light comedy was given at the South Hwanghae Provincial Art Theatre. It was enjoyed by leading officials of party and power bodies and working people's organizations, officials in the field of agriculture and working people of different strata in the province. 
					
					 The audiences were deeply impressed to watch the light comedy, noting that it is a masterpiece imbuing people with confidence that they can surely build a thriving nation on this land to be proud of when they make steady advances and bring about uninterrupted innovations by learning from the spirit of revolutionary optimism and enterprising and militant work style displayed by the people of the preceding generations. 
					
					 The performance goes on.

articles.title: River Taedong Decked with Fountains
articles.content:
River Taedong Decked with Fountains
 Pyongyang, May 14 (KCNA) -- Fountains have appeared in the River Taedong flowing through Pyongyang, the Democratic People's Republic of Korea.
					 When darkness sets in, the fountains begin to play, presenting kaleidoscope scenes, to the tune of folk songs and waltz.
					
					 They jet water high or in different directions, reminding one of flying butterfly and dove or swaying azalea petal.
					
					 Seen in the projection screen formed in the air by the squirt of water are an artificial satellite being launched and CNC machine tools being mass-produced as well as inscriptions including "Juche iron", "Huichon Speed" and "Cutting edge".
					
					 The river banks close to the fountains are inundated with people in the evening to enjoy the fountain display.

articles.title: KCNA on NPT Review Conference
articles.content:
KCNA on NPT Review Conference
 Pyongyang, May 14 (KCNA) -- What is important for building a peaceful new world free from the danger of a nuclear war at present is for the nuclear weapons states, the U.S., the world's biggest possessor of nuclear arsenal in particular, to sincerely honor their commitments to nuclear disarmament.
					 It is quite natural that voices demanding this are heard from the 8th NPT review conference which has been underway at the UN since May 3.
					
					 In 1978, the U.S., the former Soviet Union and Britain, depositories of the NPT, issued a "statement" giving assurances of non-use of nukes against the non-nuclear states which acceded to the NPT, albeit conditional.
					
					 It is regrettable, however, that this principle of the treaty has not been honored on the international arena.
					
					 The U.S., in utter disregard of its commitment under the NPT, adopted a preemptive nuclear attack as its state policy. It has openly claimed that the NPT "does not ban the modernization of nuclear combat forces" while taking the lead in replacing aging nukes with new ones, improving their performance and developing new type nuclear weapons.
					
					 It was none other than the U.S. that compelled the DPRK to pull out of the NPT.
					
					 The U.S has increased its nuclear threat to the DPRK despite the consistent efforts made by the DPRK to turn the Korean Peninsula into a nuclear-free zone.
					
					 The DPRK rendered active assistance to the IAEA in its six ad hoc inspections from May 1992 to February 1993 as per the relevant article of the NPT. The U.S., however, prodded dishonest forces within the agency into cooking up a "resolution on special inspection" targeted against not only nuclear facilities but sensitive military objects in the DPRK while ballyhooing about "suspected nuclear development" even before the ad hoc inspection was over. It even resumed the temporarily suspended Team Spirit joint military exercises, increasing its nuclear threat to the DPRK.
					
					 This provided a typical example proving that the NPT was abused as a means for justifying the U.S. arbitrary practices, far from checking them.
					
					 It was against this backdrop that the DPRK declared its pullout of the NPT on March 12, 1993 and notified the depositories of it in order to defend the sovereignty and security of the country. As the U.S. responded to the DPRK-U.S. dialogue in the subsequent period, the DPRK took a measure of declaring a moratorium on its withdrawal from the NPT while the dialogue was underway.
					
					 No sooner had the Bush administration taken office than unilaterally scrapped the "DPRK-U.S. Agreed Framework" for settling the nuclear issue on the Korean Peninsula signed during the Clinton administration, listed the DPRK as part of an "axis of evil" and released a "nuclear posture review" in which the DPRK was designated as "a target of preemptive nuclear attack".
					
					 This compelled the DPRK to take such a resolute self-defensive measure as lifting the decade-long moratorium on its withdrawal from the NPT on January 10, 2003 and completely pulling out of the treaty in order to defend the country from the U.S. serious nuclear threat.
					
					 The DPRK's withdrawal from the NPT and its accession to nukes were a legitimate and just exercise of its right to cope with the U.S. and its followers' violation of its sovereignty.
					
					 The DPRK is technically at war with the U.S. Therefore, it could not but react to the U.S. nuclear threat with nukes as the latter threatened the former with nuclear weapons after unilaterally reneging on its "assurances of non-use of nukes".
					
					 The Obama administration in its recent "nuclear posture review" excluded the DPRK, Iran and a few other countries from the "list of those countries against which nukes would not be used". This proves that its policy is little different from the hostile policy toward the DPRK pursued by the Bush administration which had posed constant nuclear threat to the DPRK after designating it as "a target of preemptive nuclear attack".
					
					 The DPRK is, therefore, left with no justification to weaken its nuclear deterrent, a means for self-defence, under the situation where the U.S. nuclear blackmail persists.
					
					 The U.S. loudly trumpets about "nuclear non-proliferation" but it is the very country which encourages the spread of nukes in actuality.
					
					 The world is bound to head for a nuclear arms race whether it likes or not unless the U.S. nuclear threat and blackmail are brought to an end.
					
					 The 8th NPT review conference is now underway at a time when many countries of the world are regarding the peaceful use of nuclear energy as an essential strategic option for achieving their sustainable development. It should, therefore, provide an opportunity of yielding positive results in such fields as disarmament, the fulfillment of commitments to nuclear non-proliferation, building nuclear-free zones and peaceful use of nuclear energy on the principles of equality and impartiality.

articles.title: Japan's Reckless Moves for Overseas Aggression under Fire
articles.content:
Japan's Reckless Moves for Overseas Aggression under Fire
 Pyongyang, May 14 (KCNA) -- Recently Japan's Air "Self-Defense Force" staged the drill of transporting PAC-3s to Sinjuku Ward, Tokyo, by various types of vehicles and deploying them. The Japanese reactionaries advertised it as "one more step forward" in rounding off the country's "defense system."
					 In this regard Rodong Sinmun Friday says in a signed commentary:
					
					 The recent drill was part of Japan's moves to complete the building of an ambitious missile shield in a bid to realize its wild design for conversion into a military giant and overseas expansion. 
					
					 Japan is apt to cover up its missile shield with the veil of "defense." This is nothing but a poor artifice to justify its criminal missile build-up and deployment.
					
					 It is the ulterior intention of the Japanese reactionaries to develop the "Self-Defense Forces" into offensive forces under the pretext of the fictitious "threat" from somebody and thus convert Japan into a military giant and launch overseas aggression.
					
					 The above-said drill was a test military operation to put into practice the scenario for overseas aggression as it was aimed at a preemptive strike, to all intents and purposes, the commentary notes, and goes on:
					
					 The Japanese reactionaries are seeking to acquire the capability for preemptive missile attacks on their neighboring countries by building missile shields with the U.S. help and hold a military edge in Northeast Asia and launch reinvasion any time.
					
					 Such reckless moves are a criminal act of disturbing the security of Northeast Asia and upsetting the military equilibrium and increasing the danger of war in the region. 
					
					 The Japanese reactionaries would be well advised to face up to the trend of the times and stop the rash military moves that will only precipitate their own destruction.

articles.title: Human Rights Abuses Protested in S. Korea
articles.content:
Human Rights Abuses Protested in S. Korea
 Pyongyang, May 14 (KCNA) -- The Joint Conference of Human Rights Organizations in south Korea protested against the fascist action taken by the puppet authorities to violate human rights on May 10.
					 The organization recalled that the fascist police walked off three human rights activists when they were staging a demonstration in demand of the freedom of expression in the plaza of Kwanghwamun in Seoul that day.
					
					 It also assailed the police for recently arresting at random those who were selling newspapers in the above-said plaza and the workers who took part in a candle-light rally. 
					
					 Deploring that the freedom of expression is being wantonly violated in all fabrics of society, the organization declared it would launch a fiercer struggle to win genuine human rights.

articles.title: Kim Jong Il's China Visit Hailed in Switzerland
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il's China Visit Hailed in Switzerland
Pyongyang, May 14 (KCNA) -- The Switzerland-Korea Committee and the Swiss Group for the Study of the Juche Idea issued a joint statement on May 9 on General Secretary Kim Jong Il's unofficial visit to the People's Republic of China.
					 The statement said:
					
					  Kim Jong Il said that invariable is the basic stand of the DPRK on maintaining the goal of denuclearizing the Korean Peninsula, implementing the joint statement issued at the six-party talks and pursuing a negotiated peaceful solution, expressing the will of the DPRK side to provide conditions favorable for the resumption of the six-party talks together with other parties to them.
					
					 The stand clarified by him was supported by the Chinese side.
					
					 Both sides expressed the stand to boost the traditional DPRK-China friendship.
					
					  Kim Jong Il's China visit greatly contributed to protecting peace and stability on the Korean Peninsula and in the Asia-Pacific region.
					
					 We were pleased to hear the news of his China visit and warmly congratulate him on his success in the visit.

articles.title: Destituido Kim Il Chol de todos sus cargos
articles.content:
Destituido Kim Il Chol de todos sus cargos
Pyongyang, 14 de mayo (ATCC) -- Segun la resolucion No.06 del Comite de Defensa Nacional de la Republica Popular Democratica de Corea publicada el dia 13, Kim Il Chol fue removido a causa de su edad avanzada (80 anos) de sus cargos de miembro del CDN y primer viceministro de las Fuerzas Armadas Populares.

articles.title: EE.UU. es culpable de proliferacion nuclear, comenta ATCC
articles.content:
EE.UU. es culpable de proliferacion nuclear, comenta ATCC
Pyongyang, 14 de mayo (ATCC) -- En la actualidad, lo importante para eliminar el peligro de guerra nuclear y construir un nuevo mundo pacifico es que los paises con armas nucleares, en particular, Estados Unidos, que tiene el arsenal nuclear mas grande del mundo, cumplan sinceramente con su obligacion de acceder al desarme nuclear.
					Es natural que cundiera esta opinion en la 8a conferencia sobre el cumplimiento del "Tratado de No Proliferacion" (TNP) que tiene lugar en la ONU a partir del dia 3.
					
					EE.UU., la ex URSS y Gran Bretana, depositadores del TNP, habian publicado en 1978 una declaracion en que se comprometieron, aunque condicionalmente, a "no usar las armas nucleares" contra los paises desnuclearizados firmantes del tratado.
					
					Lamentablemente, este principio no se mantiene ahora en la escena internacional.
					
					Sin tomar en cuenta el cumplimiento de sus deberes asumidos segun el TNP, EE.UU. proclamo el ataque preventivo nuclear como su politica estatal y toma la delantera en sustituir o mejorar la eficacia de los viejos artefactos nucleares y desarrollar los modernos insistiendo abiertamente en que el TNP "no prohibe la modernizacion de las fuerzas nucleares".
					
					Es precisamente EE.UU. el que ha forzado a la RPDC a retirarse del TNP.
					
					Este imperio vino aumentando la amenaza nuclear sobre la RPDC despreciando los invariables esfuerzos de esta por convertir la Peninsula Coreana en una zona desnuclearizada.
					
					Ateniendose al articulo correspondiente del TNP, la RPDC colaboro activamente con 6 inspecciones irregulares de la Agencia Internacional de Energia Atomica (AIEA) que se efectuaron de mayo de 1992 a febrero de 1993.
					
					Pero, aun antes de que terminara la inspeccion, EE.UU. fabrico instigando a los elementos malsanos de la AIEA la "resolucion de inspeccion especial", que perseguia monitorear no solo las instalaciones nucleares sino tambien los delicados objetivos militares de la RPDC, hablando de la supuesta "sospecha de desarrollo nuclear".
					
					Ademas, ejercio mas abiertamente la amenaza nuclear sobre la RPDC reiniciando el ejercicio militar conjunto "Team Spirit" que habia sido interrumpido.
					
					Esto muestra que el TNP no puede frenar las arbitrariedades de EE.UU., sino se utiliza como aparato para justificar su despotismo. 
					
					En tal circunstancia, la RPDC declaro el 12 de marzo de 1993 la retirada del TNP para defender la soberania y la seguridad del pais y lo aviso a los paises depositadores. Y despues, cuando EE.UU. asintio el dialogo con la RPDC, esta tomo la medida de poner en suspension temporal la vigencia de su decision de retirarse del TNP mientras que marchen las conversaciones.
					
					Tan pronto como tomo el poder, la administracion Bush rompio unilateralmente el Acuerdo Principal RPDC-EE.UU., acordado en el periodo de mandato de Clinton con el fin de resolver el problema nuclear de la Peninsula Coreana, definio a la RPDC como "eje del mal" y publico el "informe de estado nuclear" en que incluyo a esta en la lista de "objetos de ataque preventivo nuclear".
					
					Para defenderse de la grave amenaza nuclear de EE.UU., la RPDC no pudo menos de poner en vigencia la retirada del TNP, que quedaba en suspension durante 10 anos, asi que el 10 de enero de 2003 se retiro por completo del TNP.
					
					  Esta medida rotunda y la posesion nuclear de la RPDC devienen una ejecucion de sus derechos legitimos y justos frente a la violacion de la soberania por parte de EE.UU. y sus fuerzas satelites. 
					
					  La RPDC esta en lo tecnico en el estado beligerante con EE.UU. Es por eso que nos vimos obligados a responder con armas nucleares a la amenaza nuclear de EE.UU. que renuncio unilateralmente la "garantia de no usar armas nucleares". 
					
					  En el reciente "informe de revision del estado nuclear", la administracion Obama excluyo unos paises como la RPDC e Iran de los "objetos de no usar las armas nucleares". Esto significa que la politica de la actual administracion norteamericana con respecto a la RPDC es igual que la politica hostil a esta de la administracion Bush que la fijo como "objeto de ataque preventivo nuclear" y le ejercio la amenaza nuclear. 
					
					Dado que siguen los chantajes nucleares de EE.UU., la RPDC no tiene ninguna razon de debilitar su disuasivo nuclear, remedio de autodefensa. 
					
					  Aunque EE.UU. habla tanto de la "no proliferacion nuclear", en realidad, el mismo es el autor de este asunto. 
					
					  Mientras que no se eliminen la amenaza y chantajes nucleares de EE.UU., el mundo, aunque desea o no, se dirigira a la carrera armamentista nuclear.
					
					  La 8a conferencia sobre el cumplimiento del TNP, que se efectua en la circunstancia en que muchos paises del orbe toman por su opcion estrategica indispensable el uso pacifico de energia nuclear para el desarrollo sostenido, ha de ser un motivo para traer resultados positivos en la ejecucion del compromiso de desarme y de no proliferacion nuclear en el principio de igualdad e imparcialidad, la creacion de la zona desnuclearizada, el uso pacifico de la energia nuclear y en otras esferas.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun condena intento de Japon de agredir a ultramar
articles.content:
Rodong Sinmun condena intento de Japon de agredir a ultramar
						
Pyongyang, 14 de mayo (ATCC) -- En estos tiempos, las "fuerzas aereas de autodefensa" de Japon realizaron el ejercicio de trasladar y desplegar el misil antibalistico "PAC-3" movilizando los camiones de distintos generos en Sinjuku de la metropoli de Tokio.
					  Los reaccionarios japoneses lo califican de otro "avance" para perfeccionar el "sistema defensivo" de su pais.
					
					  A traves de un comentario individual difundido este viernes, el diario Rodong Sinmun revelo que ese entrenamiento forma parte de las maniobras para convertir a Japon en una potencia militar y realizar la ambicion expansionista a ultramar completando el establecimiento del ambicioso sistema antimisiles.
					
					  Si bien el pais isleno atribuye el "caracter defensivo" a tal sistema de misiles, esto no pasa de ser una artimana para justificar sus criminales maniobras para el aumento y el emplazamiento de misiles, precisa el comentarista y continua:
					
					  Lo que intentan de verdad los reaccionarios japoneses es fortalecer las "Fuerzas de Autodefensa" como las ofensivas so pretexto de la fantasmal "amenaza" de alguien para transformar a su pais en una potencia militar y ejecutar la agresion a ultramar.
					
					  El susodicho ejercicio militar persigue evidentemente el golpe preventivo, siendo el ensayo de la operacion militar para realizar su ambicion de agredir a otros paises.
					
					  Al adquirir la capacidad de atacar preventivamente con misiles a los paises circunvecinos mediante el establecimiento del sistema antimisiles en contubernio con EE.UU., ellos pretenden tomar la superioridad militar en el Nordeste Asiatico y dar inicio a la nueva agresion en cualquier momento.
					
					  Tales acciones aventureras devienen acto criminal que rompe la seguridad y el equilibrio militar de la region del Nordeste Asiatico y aumenta el peligro de guerra.
					
					  Ellos deben dejar de cometer imprudentes acciones militares, que les llevaran a la autodestruccion, viendo correctamente la corriente de la epoca.

articles.title: Entidades suizas felicitan exitos de  Kim Jong Il en su visita a China
articles.content:
Entidades suizas felicitan exitos de  Kim Jong Il en su visita a China
Pyongyang, 14 de mayo (ATCC) -- Con respecto a la visita no oficial del Dirigente Kim Jong Il a la Republica Popular China, el Comite Suiza-Corea y el Grupo Suizo de Estudio de la Idea Juche publicaron el dia 9 una declaracion conjunta.
					El Dirigente Kim Jong Il ratifico la invariable posicion de principios de Corea de mantener la meta de desnuclearizacion de la Peninsula Coreana, ejecutar la declaracion conjunta aprobada en las conversaciones a 6 bandas y perseguir la solucion pacifica a traves del dialogo, y expuso la voluntad de la parte coreana de preparar condiciones favorables al reinicio de la cita seis-partita con las demas partes participantes en esta, precisa el documento y continua:
					
					La parte china apoyo la posicion manifestada por el Dirigente.
					
					Ambas partes expresaron la posicion de consolidar la tradicional amistad Corea-China. 
					
					La visita a China del Dirigente contribuyo grandemente a la defensa de la paz y la estabilidad de la Peninsula Coreana y la region de Asia-Pacifico.
					
					Nos enteramos con mucha alegria de la noticia de esa visita y felicitamos calidamente los exitos logrados por el Dirigente en esta ocasion.

articles.title: Surtidores de baile del rio Taedong
articles.content:
Surtidores de baile del rio Taedong
Pyongyang, 14 de mayo (ATCC) -- Ultimamente, los surtidores de baile se instalaron nuevamente en el pleno centro del rio Taedong que bordea la ciudad de Pyongyang.
					Al anochecer en la orilla del rio, los surtidores demuestran sus aspectos extranos y hermosos.
					
					Describen varias figuras al compas de las canciones de matiz folklorico y de los valses.
					
					Lanzan grandiosamente el chorro de agua hacia el espacio aereo mientras lo mueven al mismo tiempo a la derecha y a la izquierda.
					
					Tambien parecen que volara la mariposa amarilla o la paloma blanca en el cielo azul y se sacudieran los petalos finos de azaleas por el viento del rio.
					
					Especialmente, las rociaduras de agua echadas por los surtidores forman un telon acuifero en el aire, en el cual aparecen las imagenes del lanzamiento del satelite artificial y de innumerables maquinas herramientas CNC y se graban los vocablos de la epoca como "Hierro Juche", "Velocidad de Huichon" y "Tecnologia de punta".
					
					Cada dia, numerosos ciudadanos concurren alli para verlos.
